decisiorama.utils package¶

Submodules¶

decisiorama.utils.random_instance module¶

Random instance module

This module contain functions to create random numbers on demand given a predefined distribution.

class decisiorama.utils.random_instance.Beta(a, b, n=None)¶

Bases: decisiorama.utils.random_instance.RandomNumber

Class to create Beta-distributed random numbers

get(n=None)¶

Method to get the random numbers

Parameters

n (int, optional) – Number of random numbers to be generated. If passed in the callback of this function, it will override the object value.

Returns

out – 1D array containing the generated random numbers

Return type

ndarray

class decisiorama.utils.random_instance.RandomNumber¶

Bases: object

Base class for the generation of random numbers. This will ensure that the adequate inheritance of parameters. Do not use this class to create random numbers.

a = None¶
b = None¶
check_lims()¶

Check that the generated values are within the prescribed limits

check_numeric()¶

Check if the values are numeric

mu = None¶
n = None¶
std = None¶

decisiorama.utils.utils module¶

Utils Module

In this module are stored all of the supporting functions which do not fall into a specific category.

decisiorama.utils.utils.core_index(sols_inp, pf)¶

calculate the core index. takes solutions and position of pareto-solutions

Parameters

  • sols_inp (ndarray) – Value of the solutions for each of the activities

  • pf (list) – List with the solutions in the pareto front. This list is can be obtained througn the pareto_front_i function.

Returns

core_index – 1D array containing the values of the core index.

Return type

ndarray

decisiorama.utils.utils.pareto_front_i(M, minimize=True, i=0)¶

Function to get a specific pareto set. i=0 means optimal

Parameters

  • M (ndarray) – 2D array containing the solution vectors

  • minimize (Bool) – Determine if the optimal of the functions is the minimum. In case is a maximisation problem, this should be set to False.

  • i (int) – Index that determines the position of the pareto front to retrieve. by default is 0, meaning the formal pareto front.

Returns

front – List containing indexes that represent each solution. The “pareto-front” is located in the front 0.

Return type

list

decisiorama.utils.utils.pareto_fronts(M, minimize=True)¶

function to calculate the pareto fronts

Parameters

  • M (ndarray) – 2D array containing the solution vectors

  • minimize (Bool) – Determine if the optimal of the functions is the minimum. In case is a maximisation problem, this should be set to False.

Returns

fronts – List containing a list of indexes that represent each solution. The “pareto-front” is located in the front 0.

Return type

list
